events.message: The customer reported an accident involving their car on the morning of April 30th at the intersection near Main St. The vehicle sustained front-end damage.
The claim was categorized as an Auto Accident based on the initial report mentioning vehicle collision and damage.
An insurance representative was assigned promptly to handle the accident claim and begin communication with the claimant.
The claimant was formally notified that their auto accident claim has been received and is being processed by the company.
The agent requested submission of photos of the damaged car, police report, and any medical bills related to the accident.
The claimant provided all requested documents including the police report and multiple images showing the extent of vehicle damage.
An internal investigation was initiated by the claims department to verify the details of the collision and assess liability.
The investigation concluded with confirmation that the claimant was not at fault and the accident qualifies under policy coverage.
A settlement offer was prepared and sent to the claimant covering the cost of repairs and minor personal injury expenses.
The claimant expressed satisfaction with the promptness and professionalism of the claims process and settlement offer.
The claim was officially approved by the claims manager following the claimant's acceptance of the settlement proposal.
The payment for the approved settlement was issued to the claimant's bank account as per the agreed terms.
The claim file was officially closed after confirming receipt of payment and no further issues reported by the claimant.
All documentation and correspondence related to the auto accident claim were archived securely for future reference.
